content: heel flap through the back loop only i recommend picking up every stitch along the heel flap and one extra stitch in the gap even if that is more than the recommended amount extra stitches can be decreased out on the following round this helps to prevent holes knit across the next 20 24 28 32 stitches for the top of the foot place marker for side of foot pick up stitches along the right side of the heel flap just as you did for the left side knit across the heel stitches and down the left side to the bor marker you should now have 48 54 60 70 stitches you will have more if you picked up additional stitches to prevent holes - make note of how many extra stitches you picked up in total 2 gusset decreases decrease extra picked-up stitches on the first decrease round by working extra ssks or k2togs as needed round 1 knit across the first 20 24 28 32 stitches k1 ssk knit to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 round 2 knit all stitches repeat these two rounds until you have 40 48 56 64 stitches foot work in stockinette until your work measures 1 5 less than the desired length it is recommended to have 0 5-1 of negative ease for the sock length example if your foot measures 9 subtract desired negative ease 0 5 to get 8 5 then subtract 1 5 for the toe to get 7 the total foot including heel needs to measure 7 before starting the toe toe round 1 knit all stitches round 2 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 twice repeat rounds 1 & 2 until you have 20 24 28 32 stitches remaining sew the toe closed using kitchener stitch finishing weave in ends and wet block socks if desired 3
